2.text: “Listen diligently to my speech. Let this be your consolation.

3.text: Allow me, and I also will speak; After I have spoken, mock on.

4.text: As for me, is my complaint to man? Why shouldn’t I be impatient?

5.text: Look at me, and be astonished. Lay your hand on your mouth.

6.text: When I remember, I am troubled. Horror takes hold of my flesh.

7.text: “Why do the wicked live, become old, yes, and grow mighty in power?

8.text: Their child is established with them in their sight, their offspring before their eyes.

9.text: Their houses are safe from fear, neither is the rod of God upon them.

10.text: Their bulls breed without fail. Their cows calve, and don’t miscarry.

11.text: They send forth their little ones like a flock. Their children dance.

12.text: They sing to the tambourine and harp, and rejoice at the sound of the pipe.

13.text: They spend their days in prosperity. In an instant they go down to Sheol.

14.text: They tell God, ‘Depart from us, for we don’t want to know about your ways.

15.text: What is the Almighty, that we should serve him? What profit should we have, if we pray to him?’

16.text: Behold, their prosperity is not in their hand. The counsel of the wicked is far from me.

17.text: “How often is it that the lamp of the wicked is put out, that their calamity comes on them, that God distributes sorrows in his anger?

18.text: How often is it that they are as stubble before the wind, as chaff that the storm carries away?

19.text: You say, ‘God lays up his iniquity for his children.’ Let him recompense it to himself, that he may know it.

20.text: Let his own eyes see his destruction. Let him drink of the wrath of the Almighty.

21.text: For what does he care for his house after him, when the number of his months is cut off?

22.text: “Shall any teach God knowledge, since he judges those who are high?

23.text: One dies in his full strength, being wholly at ease and quiet.

24.text: His pails are full of milk. The marrow of his bones is moistened.

25.text: Another dies in bitterness of soul, and never tastes of good.

26.text: They lie down alike in the dust. The worm covers them.

27.text: “Behold, I know your thoughts, the devices with which you would wrong me.

28.text: For you say, ‘Where is the house of the prince? Where is the tent in which the wicked lived?’

29.text: Haven’t you asked wayfaring men? Don’t you know their evidences,

30.text: that the evil man is reserved to the day of calamity, That they are led forth to the day of wrath?

31.text: Who shall declare his way to his face? Who shall repay him what he has done?

32.text: Yet he will be borne to the grave. Men shall keep watch over the tomb.

33.text: The clods of the valley shall be sweet to him. All men shall draw after him, as there were innumerable before him.

34.text: So how can you comfort me with nonsense, because in your answers there remains only falsehood?”
